newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares fall after Wall Street slump.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares fall after Wall Street slump.

text.p: Norwegian shares started the New Year trading in negative territory on Thursday following losses on Wall Street on Tuesday.
Dealers said the Oslo Bourse was expected to continue tracking U.S. developments on Friday.
"But Norway held its ground relatively well compared to some other European countries today," one dealer suggested.
Oslo's Total index, which hit the 55th record closing high of 1996 on Monday, shed 0.48 percent to close at 963.71 points. Turnover was a low 585 million crowns.
"Some people are still on holiday," one dealer said to explain the thin volume.
Losses were across the board with shipping worst hit.
Bergesen, Norway's biggest shipping company, saw its A share fall 2.6 percent to 152 crowns.
Industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro, Norway's biggest company, was down 0.6 percent at 343 crowns.
